text: Hi everyone. Have anyone ever had this problem. I'm in a HubDb as a Super Admin, and I cannot add columns or update column names?

Not really dev-focused, but I just saw that HubSpot has a new Lead Object as of a few months ago. Does anyone have experience using that, and how that works together with/compares to the Lead Status property? Or does it just replace the Lead status property?
Hmmm, the only thing I could suggest is to make sure you are using the latest version of the HubSpot CLI
Yeah so calculated properties can’t be used in forms because they can’t be updated
I’m really interested in what you’re trying to do though

<@U01QVR44MEY> So essentially my client wants to calculate the users potential ROI based on their answers to a few questions. and if they want to learn more about the math, they can finish filling out the form and schedule a meeting....

Now that i cant add in that calculation field im stuck. UGH
Well you could always just use the form embed code to do the math and store the number returned in another element outside of the form
we use wordpress for their website, so idk if i can do that?
Yeah it would be a little tricky but you could build out a custom wordpress component
<@U01QVR44MEY> are there any docs that can help me figure that out? I have no idea where to start :sob:
is it like that on all tables? in all portals?

My guess has always been that it’s to prevent transitions and animations from rapidly triggering over and over again when you’re editing a module that allows live updates _(e.g. doesn’t have the “Apply Updates” button)_.

Based on that snippet, if you want a  specific element to show its transitions in the editor, you could probably do something like:
```<div class="my-class {{ 'hs-allow-transition' if is_in_editor }}"> ... </div>```

yeah … unfortunately it doesn’t cascade down. So i can’t just slap it on a module. I have to put it on every element for some particular modules (i.e. a button, the button’s icon, the buttons text, the buttons background el)… and pseudo els are another animal
